methods.readCsv:
**Incompatible overloads text - text from the first overload:**

Creates an in-memory table from path by importing CSV data according to the specs.

 
 A path that ends in ".tar.zip", ".tar.bz2", ".tar.gz", ".tar.7z", ".tar.zst", ".zip", ".bz2", ".gz",
 ".7z", ".zst", or ".tar" will be decompressed.

*Overload 1*  
  :param path: (java.lang.String) - the path
  :return: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) the table
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param stream: (java.io.InputStream) - an InputStream providing access to the CSV data.
  :return: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) a Deephaven Table object
  
*Overload 3*  
  :param url: (java.net.URL) - the url
  :return: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) the table
  
*Overload 4*  
  :param path: (java.nio.file.Path) - the file path
  :return: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) the table
  
*Overload 5*  
  :param path: (java.lang.String) - the path
  :param specs: (io.deephaven.db.tables.utils.csv.CsvSpecs) - the csv specs
  :return: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) the table
  
*Overload 6*  
  :param stream: (java.io.InputStream) - the stream
  :param specs: (io.deephaven.db.tables.utils.csv.CsvSpecs) - the csv specs
  :return: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) the table
  
*Overload 7*  
  :param url: (java.net.URL) - the url
  :param specs: (io.deephaven.db.tables.utils.csv.CsvSpecs) - the csv specs
  :return: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) the table
  
*Overload 8*  
  :param path: (java.nio.file.Path) - the path
  :param specs: (io.deephaven.db.tables.utils.csv.CsvSpecs) - the csv specs
  :return: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) the table
  
*Overload 9*  
  :param is: (java.io.InputStream) - an InputStream providing access to the CSV data.
  :param format: (java.lang.String) - an Apache Commons CSV format name to be used to parse the CSV, or a single non-newline character to
          use as a delimiter.
  :return: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) a Deephaven Table object
  
*Overload 10*  
  :param is: (java.io.InputStream) - an InputStream providing access to the CSV data.
  :param separator: (char) - a char to use as the delimiter value when parsing the file.
  :return: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) a Deephaven Table object
methods.writeCsv:
Writes a table out as a CSV file.

*Overload 1*  
  :param source: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) - a Deephaven table object to be exported
  :param destPath: (java.lang.String) - path to the CSV file to be written
  :param compressed: (boolean) - whether to zip the file being written
  :param timeZone: (io.deephaven.db.tables.utils.DBTimeZone) - a DBTimeZone constant relative to which DBDateTime data should be adjusted
  :param progress: (io.deephaven.base.Procedure.Binary<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Long>) - a procedure that implements Procedure.Binary, and takes a progress Integer and a total size
          Integer to update progress
  :param columns: (java.lang.String...) - a list of columns to include in the export
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param source: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) - a Deephaven table object to be exported
  :param destPath: (java.lang.String) - path to the CSV file to be written
  :param compressed: (boolean) - whether to zip the file being written
  :param timeZone: (io.deephaven.db.tables.utils.DBTimeZone) - a DBTimeZone constant relative to which DBDateTime data should be adjusted
  :param progress: (io.deephaven.base.Procedure.Binary<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Long>) - a procedure that implements Procedure.Binary, and takes a progress Integer and a total size
          Integer to update progress
  :param nullsAsEmpty: (boolean) - if nulls should be written as blank instead of '(null)'
  :param columns: (java.lang.String...) - a list of columns to include in the export
  
*Overload 3*  
  :param source: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) - a Deephaven table object to be exported
  :param destPath: (java.lang.String) - path to the CSV file to be written
  :param compressed: (boolean) - whether to zip the file being written
  :param timeZone: (io.deephaven.db.tables.utils.DBTimeZone) - a DBTimeZone constant relative to which DBDateTime data should be adjusted
  :param progress: (io.deephaven.base.Procedure.Binary<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Long>) - a procedure that implements Procedure.Binary, and takes a progress Integer and a total size
          Integer to update progress
  :param nullsAsEmpty: (boolean) - if nulls should be written as blank instead of '(null)'
  :param separator: (char) - the delimiter for the CSV
  :param columns: (java.lang.String...) - a list of columns to include in the export
  
*Overload 4*  
  :param source: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) - a Deephaven table object to be exported
  :param out: (java.io.BufferedWriter) - BufferedWriter used to write the CSV
  :param timeZone: (io.deephaven.db.tables.utils.DBTimeZone) - a DBTimeZone constant relative to which DBDateTime data should be adjusted
  :param progress: (io.deephaven.base.Procedure.Binary<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Long>) - a procedure that implements Procedure.Binary, and takes a progress Integer and a total size
          Integer to update progress
  :param nullsAsEmpty: (boolean) - if nulls should be written as blank instead of '(null)'
  :param columns: (java.lang.String...) - a list of columns to include in the export
  
*Overload 5*  
  :param source: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) - a Deephaven table object to be exported
  :param out: (java.io.BufferedWriter) - BufferedWriter used to write the CSV
  :param timeZone: (io.deephaven.db.tables.utils.DBTimeZone) - a DBTimeZone constant relative to which DBDateTime data should be adjusted
  :param progress: (io.deephaven.base.Procedure.Binary<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Long>) - a procedure that implements Procedure.Binary, and takes a progress Integer and a total size
          Integer to update progress
  :param nullsAsEmpty: (boolean) - if nulls should be written as blank instead of '(null)'
  :param separator: (char) - the delimiter for the CSV
  :param columns: (java.lang.String...) - a list of columns to include in the export
methods.writeCsvContents:
Writes a table out as a CSV file.

*Overload 1*  
  :param source: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) - a Deephaven table object to be exported
  :param out: (java.io.BufferedWriter) - a BufferedWriter to which the header should be written
  :param timeZone: (io.deephaven.db.tables.utils.DBTimeZone) - a DBTimeZone constant relative to which DBDateTime data should be adjusted
  :param colNames: (java.lang.String...) - a list of columns to include in the export
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param source: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) - a Deephaven table object to be exported
  :param out: (java.io.BufferedWriter) - a BufferedWriter to which the header should be written
  :param timeZone: (io.deephaven.db.tables.utils.DBTimeZone) - a DBTimeZone constant relative to which DBDateTime data should be adjusted
  :param nullsAsEmpty: (boolean) - if nulls should be written as blank instead of '(null)'
  :param colNames: (java.lang.String...) - a list of columns to include in the export
  
*Overload 3*  
  :param source: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) - a Deephaven table object to be exported
  :param out: (java.io.BufferedWriter) - a BufferedWriter to which the header should be written
  :param timeZone: (io.deephaven.db.tables.utils.DBTimeZone) - a DBTimeZone constant relative to which DBDateTime data should be adjusted
  :param progress: (io.deephaven.base.Procedure.Binary<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Long>) - a procedure that implements Procedure.Binary, and takes a progress Integer and a total size
          Integer to update progress
  :param colNames: (java.lang.String...) - a list of columns to include in the export
  
*Overload 4*  
  :param source: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) - a Deephaven table object to be exported
  :param out: (java.io.BufferedWriter) - a BufferedWriter to which the header should be written
  :param timeZone: (io.deephaven.db.tables.utils.DBTimeZone) - a DBTimeZone constant relative to which DBDateTime data should be adjusted
  :param progress: (io.deephaven.base.Procedure.Binary<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Long>) - a procedure that implements Procedure.Binary, and takes a progress Integer and a total size
          Integer to update progress
  :param nullsAsEmpty: (boolean) - if nulls should be written as blank instead of '(null)'
  :param colNames: (java.lang.String...) - a list of columns to include in the export
  
*Overload 5*  
  :param source: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) - a Deephaven table object to be exported
  :param out: (java.io.BufferedWriter) - a BufferedWriter to which the header should be written
  :param timeZone: (io.deephaven.db.tables.utils.DBTimeZone) - a DBTimeZone constant relative to which DBDateTime data should be adjusted
  :param progress: (io.deephaven.base.Procedure.Binary<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Long>) - a procedure that implements Procedure.Binary, and takes a progress Integer and a total size
          Integer to update progress
  :param nullsAsEmpty: (boolean) - if nulls should be written as blank instead of '(null)'
  :param separator: (char) - the delimiter for the CSV
  :param colNames: (java.lang.String...) - a list of columns to include in the export
methods.writeCsvHeader:
Writes the column name header row to a CSV file.

*Overload 1*  
  :param out: (java.io.BufferedWriter) - the BufferedWriter to which the header should be written
  :param columns: (java.lang.String...) - a list of column names to be written
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param out: (java.io.BufferedWriter) - the BufferedWriter to which the header should be written
  :param separator: (char) - a char to use as the delimiter value when writing out the header
  :param columns: (java.lang.String...) - a list of column names to be written
methods.writeCsvPaginate:
Writes a Deephaven table to one or more files, splitting it based on the MAX_CSV_LINE_COUNT setting.

*Overload 1*  
  :param source: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) - a Deephaven table to be exported
  :param destPath: (java.lang.String) - the path in which the CSV file(s) should be written
  :param filename: (java.lang.String) - the base file name to use for the files. A dash and starting line number will be concatenated to
          each file.
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param source: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) - a Deephaven table to be exported
  :param destPath: (java.lang.String) - the path in which the CSV file(s) should be written
  :param filename: (java.lang.String) - the base file name to use for the files. A dash and starting line number will be concatenated to
          each file.
  :param nullsAsEmpty: (boolean) - if nulls should be written as blank instead of '(null)'
methods.writeToMultipleFiles:
Writes a subset of rows from a Deephaven table to a CSV file.

*Overload 1*  
  :param table: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) - a Deephaven table from which rows should be exported
  :param path: (java.lang.String) - the destination path in which the output CSV file should be created
  :param filename: (java.lang.String) - the base file name to which a dash and starting line number will be concatenated for the file
  :param startLine: (long) - the starting line number from the table to export; the ending line number will be startLine +
          MAX_CSV_LINE_COUNT-1, or the end of the table
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param table: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) - a Deephaven table from which rows should be exported
  :param path: (java.lang.String) - the destination path in which the output CSV file should be created
  :param filename: (java.lang.String) - the base file name to which a dash and starting line number will be concatenated for the file
  :param startLine: (long) - the starting line number from the table to export; the ending line number will be startLine +
          MAX_CSV_LINE_COUNT-1, or the end of the table
  :param nullsAsEmpty: (boolean) - if nulls should be written as blank instead of '(null)'

text: Utilities for reading and writing CSV files to and from Tables
